titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1866-2017 UA.6.5.1
titlestmt.author: Emily Schoenlein.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:34:47 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records
did.abstract: The University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association's mission is to advance the university and enrich students and alumni worldwide. Begun as a social organization, the association now offers programs for alumni and encourages them to contribute their time, talent, and resources for the benefit of the university and other alumni. This collection documents these activities as well as planning and day-to-day operations of the association.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Alumni Association of the Western University of Pennsylvania was formed on June 27, 1866, when a group of alumni agreed to meet for dinner once a year. The earliest known constitution and by-laws were accepted on June 29, 1892. The organization adopted the name General Alumni Association in February 1897. A new constitution and by-laws were adopted when the Western University of Pennsylvania became the University of Pittsburgh in 1908. The constitution and by-laws were once again adapted when the organization changed its name to the University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association on April 6, 1988.

The University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association's mission is to offer programs for alumni and encourage them to contribute their time, talent, and resources for the benefit of the university and other alumni, and to serve as advocates for the university within the Pittsburgh community, in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, and throughout the world. The Alumni Association also provides social and educational events for alumni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records document the activities of the association as it worked to serve the university and provide social events for alumni. Much of the material concerns the association's day-to-day operations through the documentation of normal business activities, such as memoranda; correspondence; meeting agenda, minutes, and information packets; presentations and talking points; election and nomination materials; and event planning files. Also included are strategic plans, by-laws and constitutions, and publications. Additionally, the collection documents the participation of the association and its staff in the Council of Alumni Association Executives (CAAE) and the Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE). Overall, the collection is rich in information pertaining to the policy decisions of the association throughout its history, particularly under the direction of executive director Leland Patouillet, as well as its relationships with its constituency groups and the university.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1895-2012, UA.6.5.1, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1866-2017, UA.6.5.1, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection consists of eleven series:
Series II. Alumni Council and Board of Trustees, 1869-2007

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted due to the presence of personal information and requires a signed confidential agreement. Boxes 29-34 are closed.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Emily Schoenlein in May-November 2014. Preliminary appraisal and organization of the collection was done by Sarah Hayes and Anne Morgans between 2010 and 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records in this series detail the general operations of the office and staff of the Alumni Association as they perform their duties to lead the organization. It includes items regarding personnel (including former Executive Director Leland Patouillet) and membership, board meetings and meetings with individuals, strategic planning, scholarships, and the Alumni Legislative Network.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Leland "Lee" Patouillet served as the executive director of the Pitt Alumni Association and Associate Vice Chancellor for Alumni Relations from July 1991 to August 2008. Under Patouillet, the alumni association expanded in membership and professionalization, transforming alumni relations at the university. During his tenure, Patouillet earned a Ph.D. in Administrative and Policy Studies from the University of Pittsburgh with a dissertation focused on alumni engagement. He was a charter member of the Council of Alumni Association Executives (CAAE) and an active member of the Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE), for which he was a charter member of the editorial board for The CASE International Journal of Educational Advancement. Patouillet was also the founding chair of the Big-East Alumni Professional's Conference. Much of this collection documents his work to transform alumni relations at Pitt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and reports pertaining to members of the alumni association's board of directors. Included is personal and donor information about the members, as well as position nominations, self assessments of performance, and other evaluations of board activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence, studies, and reports documenting alumni association membership. Included is information on member demographics, the implementation of dues, and outreach initiatives.

did.unittitle: Alumni Dues and Annual Fund Survey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and other information about meetings between members of the alumni association and alumni relations staff and individuals within the University of Pittsburgh and constituent groups.

did.unittitle: African American Alumni Council and Maureen Cross Bolden
Marvin Roth, Placement and Career Services

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents planning activities leading up to meetings of the alumni association board of directors. Included are correspondence, invoices, and drafts of agendas, memoranda, and other communications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in this subseries are meeting minutes, correspondence, and reports pertaining to strategic and long range planning initiatives of the alumni association.

did.unittitle: Alumni Association Ad Hoc Campaign Strategy Committee Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the planning and awarding of scholarships issued by the alumni association.

did.unittitle: Pitt Alumni Scholarship Program Criteria Response Forms

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the planning and activities of the Alumni Legislative Network, which advocated for the University of Pittsburgh in the Pennsylvania and federal legislature.

Alumni Council and Board of Trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records in this series relate to the governing documents of the Alumni Association and the decisions made by the Alumni Council and the Board of Trustees. It contains governing documents, records of Alumni Council, meeting minutes from the Board of Directors and Board of Trustees, minutes from the Executive Board, board retreat information, and records of the Nominations Committee and the Institutional Advancement Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains various versions of the alumni association constitution, by-laws, and other governing documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes of alumni association meetings dating to its origin in 1866 through 2008. Included are minutes of the General Alumni Association, Alumni Council, and Board of Directors. Minutes of the Executive and Nominating Committees are also present, but access to those committee minutes are restricted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains planning information, agendas, and attendee information packets for board member retreats and new board member orientation events.

did.unittitle: Executive Committee/Blue and Gold Society Retreat
Executive Committee/Blue and Gold Society Retreat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains information about the nomination and selection of alumni association board members and alumni trustees for the University of Pittsburgh.

did.unittitle: Elections - Alumni Correspondence, Officers, Directors and Trustees
Nominations- Directors at Large and Regional Directors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting minutes and presentations, reports, and other information documenting collaborative efforts between the alumni association and the University of Pittsburgh's Office of Institutional Advancement.

did.unittitle: Institutional Advancement Third Quarter Review Meeting
Institutional Advancement First Quarter Review Meeting
Institutional Advancement Second Quarter Review Meeting
Presentation to Institutional Advancement Committee- Eva Bloom

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the day to day correspondence of the executive director of the alumni association. Included are letters to alumni relations staff, University of Pittsburgh officials and administrators, alumni association board members, and alumni, among others. Much of the correspondence consists of congratulations and thank you letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to the finances of the Alumni Association. It includes information on fundraising and the association's financial reports, such as business expenses, budgets, and financial records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records in this subseries document planning for fundraising events, including a murder mystery dinner, Monte Carlo night, and receptions with athletics coaches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains annual budgets and financial reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to the various groups associated with the Alumni Association, such as the African American Alumni Council, the Alumnae Council, the Pitt Alumni Recruitment Team, and other university constituent groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting information and correspondence with members of the African American Alumni Council (AAAC). Also included are event flyers, newsletters, and copies of the Blue, Gold and Black publication.

did.unittitle: Alleghenians Ltd., Inc., 10th Annual Celebration Evening of Recognition- Rev. J.A. Williams Award Dinner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and planning information for events hosted by the Alumnae Association, including Lantern Night and children's holiday parties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains informational manuals and recruitment information for members of the alumni recruitment team. Also included is correspondence pertaining to the travel and recruitment activities of Bruce Neimeyer, a financial aid counselor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence, membership lists, and meeting notes pertaining to some of the organizations that share an interest in engaging University of Pittsburgh alumni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to how alumni can stay in touch or be contacted. This includes the Alumni Online Community and Alumni Directory initiatives, as well as several copies of the Alumni Directory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents early developments in creating an online community for University of Pittsburgh alumni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and drafts of University of Pittsburgh alumni directories.

did.unittitle: Alumni Directory- Editorial Section Original Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series documents events and activities sponsored by or attended by members of the Alumni Association. The Alumni Association has held events related to Homecoming and basketball and football games, as well as hosting dinners and receptions and award presentations. They have also held lecture series and similar events such as University on the Road and the Chancellor's Tour in order to promote the university. Events like Pittnics, Pitt Day, Discovery Weekend, and the Summer Discovery Showcase have all helped to promote the university as well. Constituent groups like the African American Alumni Council have held their own events, and there have been memorial events and a variety of other events for Alumni Association members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains planning documentation and presentations for the Alumni Leadership Conference. This conference included leaders from the general alumni association and constituent groups as well as alumni relations staff to discuss broader initiatives of the university and alumni engagement.

did.unittitle: Alumni Leaders Conference Panels, Focus Groups, Keynote Speeches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records in this series document planning and events held during fall Homecoming festivities, as well as reunion weekends hosted in the spring.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains information about a variety of events hosted by the AAAC, including their Homecoming Sankofa events and reunions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in this subseries are planning materials for alumni events hosted in conjunction with the football and men's basketball teams. These include organized trips to watch the basketball team compete in the NCAA tournament, as well as gatherings at home and away regular season football games and bowl games.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the planning of banquets and other events celebrating alumni, including the distinguished alumni and volunteer of the year awards.

did.unittitle: Distinguished Alumni Fellows Award- Honors Convocation
Distinguished Alumni Fellows Award- Honors Convocation
Distinguished Alumni Fellows Award- Honors Convocation
Distinguished Alumni Fellows Award- Honors Convocation
Distinguished Daughters of Pennsylvania Award- Bibiana Boerio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains information about planning alumni association events in cities other than Pittsburgh, including Philadelphia, Washington DC, New York, Los Angeles, and others. These events were organized to share information about the University of Pittsburgh's current initiatives and the activities of the association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In 1997, Chancellor Mark Nordenberg traveled to several cities throughout the country to meet with alumni and share information about the status of the University of Pittsburgh. This subseries documents the planning of these events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains planning information for the annual Pitt Day in Harrisburg event. This event includes alumni, faculty, staff, and students meeting with Pennsylvania state legislators to advocate for the University of Pittsburgh and articulate how the university contributes to the state's success.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the planning of lecture events organized for alumni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pittnics were hosted by regional alumni association groups to engage active members and recruit interested alumni. They also served as a means of welcoming incoming students before they began their freshman year at the university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discovery Weekend was the kick off event for the University of Pittsburgh's capital campaign. Included are correspondence and other planning documents concerning the logistics of the event. Also present are programs and other promotional materials outlining the programming for the weekend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the planning and execution of the Summer Discovery Showcase. This event served as a way to introduce alumni to the new Petersen Events Center, as well as share some of the research and other initiatives being undertaken at the University of Pittsburgh.

did.unittitle: Summer Discovery Showcase- Public Affairs & Publications
Summer Discovery Showcase- Chancellor Nordenberg Presentation
Summer Discovery Showcase- Host Committee and Volunteers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents planning efforts for several dinners and receptions hosted by the alumni association.

did.unittitle: Heinz Chapel Choir Concert and Dinner
Jewish National Fund Tree of Life Dinner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records in this subseries document the planning of one-off alumni association events like lectures, seminars, and golf outings, among others.

did.unittitle: Night of the Panther Signature Book
Best of Both Worlds Academic/Athletic Expo
Ralph Nader and Pat Buchanan Debate
Chesapeake & Potomac Pitt Club Golf Tournament
PAA School of Nursing Golf Outing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to various programs and projects initiated by the Alumni Association, including the Banner Program for alumni association chapters, fundraising campaigns, and the plans regarding the conversion of the Masonic Temple into Alumni Hall. There are also records related to alumni feedback concerning the demolition of Pitt Stadium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of two professional organizations of which the Alumni Association is a member. Former Alumni Association Executive Director Lee Patouillet was an active member of these groups, so these records primarily reflect his participation and interests.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence pertaining to meetings and CAAE initiatives, particularly the creation of historical member lists.

did.unittitle: CAAE Summer Institute- Lake Lawn Resort
CAAE Correspondence- Special Needs of Alumni
CAAE Correspondence- Alumni Hall of Fame
Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents CASE meetings and conferences, as well as planning for its publication, International Journal of Educational Advancement.

did.unittitle: CASE Circle of Excellence Program Submissions
CASE Summit for Advancement Leaders- Correspondence

CASE International Journal of Educational Advancement - Planning
CASE International Journal of Educational Advancement - Planning
CASE International Journal of Educational Advancement - Correspondence
CASE International Journal of Educational Advancement - Planning

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains several of the publications produced by the Alumni Association. Included is the published annual report of the organization, as well as the Pitt Advocate, the Alumni Connections, and the World of Giving newsletters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains some documents reflecting early activities of the Alumni Association. Most of the records are from the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.

did.unittitle: News Article- Pitt Junior College Notes
General Alumni Association Letter Regarding Alumni Banquet
Report of the Meetings of the Association of Alumni Funds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records that do not pertain to any other series in the collection. They often detail aspects of the Alumni Association, including policies, or general information about the University of Pittsburgh and its programs. Also present are documents of historical importance, including alumni memories of the university and the September 11 attacks. Several reports containing information about University of Pittsburgh alumni and strategic planning are included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio-visual material related to the Alumni Association. It is primarily VHS tapes but it also contains slides, CD-ROMS, DVDs, and digital camera memory cards.
